body_html: @apaszke @cpuhrsch I've just checked this on the stackoverflow and found that in MSVC this is an C++ 17 feature. You can try to turn it on by using CXX_COMPILER_FLAG /std:c++latest. If we use this, then the support for VS 2015 will be over and we could not generate CUDA 8 packages any more.
body_text: @apaszke @cpuhrsch  I've just checked this on the stackoverflow and found that in MSVC this is an C++ 17 feature. You can try to turn it on by using CXX_COMPILER_FLAG  /std:c++latest. If we use this, then the support for VS 2015 will be over and we could not generate CUDA 8 packages any more.
body: @apaszke @cpuhrsch  I've just checked this on the stackoverflow and found that in MSVC this is an C++ 17 feature. You can try to turn it on by using CXX_COMPILER_FLAG ` /std:c++latest`. If we use this, then the support for VS 2015 will be over and we could not generate CUDA 8 packages any more.
